actions.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 85.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-362, by Mr. Frost.

Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Resolving that, upon adoption of this resolution, the House shall be considered to have taken the bill S. 543 from the Speaker's table and to have amended the Senate bill by striking out all after the enacting clause and inserting in lieu thereof the provisions of H.R. 3768 as passed by the House. After passage of the Senate bill, the House shall be considered to have insisted on its amendment to S. 543, requested a conference. The Speaker may appoint conferees. One motion to instruct is in order if offered by the Minority Leader on Monday, Nov. 25.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 294.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 91 (Roll no. 422).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: To expedite a conference with the Senate on a banking bill.

summary.text: Considers S. 543 (banks and banking) to be taken from the Speaker's table with an amendment that strikes out all after the enacting clause and inserts in lieu thereof the provisions of H.R. 3768 (banks and banking) as passed by the House. Considers the House to have requested a conference with the Senate as soon as S. 543 passes.

titles.title: To expedite a conference with the Senate on a banking bill.
